#summary redirectTo([url,protocol,onlyPath,addToken,anchor,params,controller,back,action,host,route,id,statusCode])
#labels api,0.8,controller,request

_*Note:* This wiki contains "bleeding edge" documentation, which may reflect a future version of Wheels. Entries in the wiki may also be incomplete and unedited. For the "official" documentation, please visit [http://www.cfwheels.com/docs Official ColdFusion on Wheels Documentation]._

*Description*:

Redirects the browser to the supplied action, URL or to the referring URL.

*Return Type*:

Void

*

*History*:

-

*Parameters*:

||   || *Type* || *Required* || *Default* || *Description* ||
|| *url* || string || false ||  || Address to redirect to ||
|| *protocol* || string || false ||  || Pass-through argument; see documentation for URLFor ||
|| *onlyPath* || boolean || false || true || Pass-through argument; see documentation for URLFor ||
|| *addToken* || boolean || false || false || Pass-through argument; see documentation for cflocation ||
|| *anchor* || string || false ||  || Pass-through argument; see documentation for URLFor ||
|| *params* || string || false ||  || Pass-through argument; see documentation for URLFor ||
|| *controller* || string || false ||  || Pass-through argument; see documentation for URLFor ||
|| *back* || boolean || false || false || Whether or not to redirect back to the referring address ||
|| *action* || string || false ||  || Pass-through argument; see documentation for URLFor ||
|| *host* || string || false ||  || Pass-through argument; see documentation for URLFor ||
|| *route* || string || false ||  || Pass-through argument; see documentation for URLFor ||
|| *id* || numeric || false || 0 || Pass-through argument; see documentation for URLFor ||
|| *statusCode* || numeric || false || 302 || Pass-through argument; see documentation for cflocation ||

*Usage*:

This function uses the cflocation tag to redirect the browser.
You can redirect to a controller/action/id in your application, a specific URL or back to the referring URL.
Internally it uses URLFor (when a controller/action/id is supplied) to build the URL to redirect to so it can also accept all arguments of URLFor.

*Examples*:

{{{
<cfif user.save()>
  <cfset redirectTo(action="saveSuccessful")>
</cfif>
}}}

{{{
<cfset redirectTo(url="http://www.cfwheels.com")>
}}}

{{{
<cfset redirectTo(back=true)>


}}}
